subSubSection.paragraph: Small tree or shrub, up to 5 m tall; vegetative and reproductive parts glabrous (externally); young shoots brown, smooth; older shoots reddish brown, glossy, flaking. Leaves with petioles 0.5–1.5 cm long; blades narrowly elliptic or narrowly ovate, (5.5–)7–12 × (1.3 –)1.7–3(–4) cm, coriaceous, drying glossy and greenish brown or, more rarely, brown above, glossy and somewhat paler below; apex acuminate or, more rarely, acute, acumen 0.3–1.2 cm long; base attenuate; secondary veins 7–12 on each side of midrib; ciliate pit domatia sometimes present; stipules 0.5–1 cm long, basal cone 1.5–2.5 mm long, free parts of sheaths 2.5–5 mm long, triangular with acute tips. Inflorescences 3–12-flowered; peduncle 1.5–13.5 cm long; first order axes up to 2 mm long, rarely up to 35 mm long; first order bracts consisting of 1–2 mm high, triangular sheaths (but up to 5 mm high and keeled in case of long first order axes) and blades linear, narrowly elliptic, narrowly ovate or, more rarely, ovate, 0.3–3.5 × 0.1–1.5 cm with attenuate bases and 3–6 mm long petioles or, more rarely, similar in size and shape to the vegetative leaves; higher order bracts usually absent, if present, then linear, 3–4 mm long; bracteoles absent. Flowers sweetly scented, shortly pedicellate, pedicels 2–8 mm long; calyx tube 1–2 mm long, glabrous and without colleters inside; calyx lobes 4.5–10 × 0.3–0.75(–1) mm, not ciliate at the base outside, glabrous inside, tips rounded; corolla tube (10–) 22–30 mm long, moderately villose in the upper half inside; corolla lobes 8–11 × 2–3 mm , tips obtuse to rounded; anthers 4.5–5.5 mm long, only the tips ( 1–2 mm ) exserted from the corolla tube at anthesis, inserted ca 2 mm below the level of the throat, white; ovary 1–2 mm long, sometimes faintly ribbed longitudinally (when dry); 3–7 ovules per locule; stigma exserted from corolla tube for 4–6 mm at anthesis, receptive zone 15 –25 mm long. Fruits 4–6 × 7–8 mm (persistent calyx not included); pyrene thin, crustaceous, without preformed germination slits; septum not stony; seeds 2–6 per fruit, 3.5–4.5 × 2.5–3 mm .

caption.paragraph:
Fig. 3.
Homollea longiflora
Arènes
. A . Flowering
branch. B . Stipules. C . Ovary and calyx. D . Corolla, stamens, style and stigma. E . Placenta with ovules, abaxial view. F . Placenta with ovules, adaxial view. G . Fruit. H . Transverse section through fruit. I . Seed, lateral view. J . Seed, adaxial view. Drawn by Mr. A. Fernandez. A, C–D from Saboureau 7 (P); B, H–J from De Block et al. 2341 (BR); E–F from De Block et al. 768 (BR); G from Dorr & Koenders 3017 (MO).

subSubSection.paragraph: Known from Mahajanga Province in western Madagascar , centred in the Boeny Region with one collection from the Bongolava Region ; mostly collected from the Ankarafantsika Reserve and surroundings ( Fig. 6A ).

Lowland dry semideciduous or deciduous forest; on sandy soil, alt.
0– 200 m
. Flowering: January– February, with peak in February; fruiting: March–May.

Endangered: EN B1ab(iii) + 2ab(iii). The extent of occurrence (EOO) of
H. longiflora
is estimated to be 1,209 km 2 and its area of occupancy (AOO) 36 km 2 using a cell width of 3 km . All collecting localities fall within the Ankarafantsika National Park and the Bongolava New Protected Area (created in 2006). The major threat for this species is habitat loss since both protected areas are under threat by logging for charcoal and timber, burning for grazing and slash-and-burn agriculture ( Nicoll & Langrand 1989 ). The sandy soil, once denuded, erodes quickly and vegetations do not recover. The distribution of this species is insufficiently known since all but three of the 15 specimens available at this time are from the Ankarafantsika National Park (mostly from the Ampijoroa Forest station near Lake Ravelobe), an area easily accessible to collectors. Considering the threats, and the fact that the species is distributed in only three locations,
H. longiflora
is assessed as Endangered (EN).
The holotype, Saboureau 7 , bears a handwritten label by Saboureau. Duplicates are available at P and TAN (with similar handwritten labels), but are labelled as coll. ignot. 1857-RN .
